quote: Nature is the art of God.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: Nature is pleased with simplicity. And nature is no dummy
author: Isaac Newton

quote: Sex is part of nature. I go along with nature.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: When man becomes greater than nature, nature, which gave us birth, will respond.
author: Loren Eiseley

quote: If you thought you were trying to find out more about it because you're gonna get an answer to some deep philosophical question...you may be wrong! It may be that you can't get an answer to that particular question by finding out more about the character of nature. But my interest in science is to simply find out about the world.
author: Richard Feynman

quote: Nature, it seems, is the popular namefor milliards and milliards and milliardsof particles playing their infinite gameof billiards and billiards and billiards.
author: Piet Hein

quote: Nature is inside art as its content, not outside as its model.
author: Marilyn French

quote: Man masters nature not by force, but by understanding
author: Jacob Bronowski

quote: In the end, nature is inexorable: it has no reason to hurry and, sooner or later, it takes what belongs to it. Unconsciously and inflexibly obedient to its own laws, it doesn't know art, just as it doesn't know freedom, just as it doesn't know goodness.
author: Ivan Turgenev

quote: Nature is always talking to you, smiling to you, and singing to you. To understand, you just have to be open to listen with your heart and soul.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: The tree which moves some to tears of joy is in the eyes of others only a green thing that stands in the way. Some see nature all ridicule and deformity... and some scarce see nature at all. But to the eyes of the man of imagination, nature is imagination itself.
author: William Blake

quote: Great art picks up where nature ends.
author: Marc Chagall

quote: A friend may well be reckoned the masterpiece of nature.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Dans la nature rien ne se crée, rien ne se perd, tout change.In nature nothing is created, nothing is lost, everything changes.
author: Antoine Lavoisier,  Traité élémentaire de chimie

quote: The first law of nature is self-preservation. Cut off that which may harm you. But if it is worth preserving, and is meaningful, nourish it and have no regrets. Ultimately, this is true living and love of self...from within.
author: T.F. Hodge,  From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph Over Death and Conscious Encounters with "The Divine Presence"

quote: Science cannot solve the ultimate mystery of nature. And that is because, in the last analysis, we ourselves are a part of the mystery that we are trying to solve.
author: Max Planck,  Where is Science Going?

quote: Art in Nature is rhythmic and has a horror of constraint.
author: Robert Delaunay

quote: Like nature, we must grow with tranquility, beauty, harmony, and love.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Two things amazes me the most, the beauty of nature and the power of my thoughts.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Scientific principles and laws do not lie on the surface of nature. They are hidden, and must be wrested from nature by an active and elaborate technique of inquiry.
author: John Dewey,  Reconstruction in Philosophy

quote: When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world.
author: John Muir

quote: It's very, very dangerous to lose contact with living nature.
author: Albert Hofmann

quote: I believe in God, only I spell it Nature.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright,  Truth Against the World: Frank Lloyd Wright Speaks for an Organic Architecture

quote: There's no greater show on earth than observing human nature
author: Benny Bellamacina,  Little Luigi: A Musical Adventure

quote: All men by nature desire knowledge.
author: Aristotle,  On Man in the Universe

quote: Learning is by nature curiosity... prying into everything, reluctant to leave anything, material or immaterial, unexplained.
author: Philo of Alexandria

quote: Whether in the intellectual pursuits of science or in the mystical pursuits of the spirit, the light beckons ahead, and the purpose surging in our nature responds.
author: Arthur Stanley Eddington,  The Nature of the Physical World

quote: All things are artificial, for nature is the art of God.
author: Thomas Browne

quote: Science, like art, is not a copy of nature but a re-creation of her.
author: Jacob Bronowski,  Science & Human Values

quote: Contrary to the ecologists, nature does not stand still and does not maintain the kind of equilibrium that guarantees the survival of any particular species - least of all the survival of her greatest and most fragile product: man.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Nature alone can lead to the understanding of art, just as art brings us back to nature with greater awarness. It is the source of all beauty, since it is the source of all life.
author: Eugène Carrière

quote: The history of science is the saga of nature defying common sense.
author: Kedar Joshi

quote: It's the idea that people living close to nature tend to be noble. It's seeing all those sunsets that does it. You can't watch a sunset and then go off and set fire to your neighbor's tepee. Living close to nature is wonderful for your mental health.
author: Daniel Quinn,  Ishmael: An Adventure of the Mind and Spirit

quote: Nothing is art if it does not come from nature.
author: Antoni Gaudi

quote: Art is a harmony parallel with nature.
author: Paul Cezanne

quote: There are worlds of experience beyond the world of the aggressive man, beyond history, and beyond science. The moods and qualities of nature and the revelations of great art are equally difficult to define; we can grasp them only in the depths of our perceptive spirit.
author: Ansel Adams

quote: One thing I have learned in a long life: that all our science, measured against reality, is primitive and childlike -- and yet it is the most precious thing we have.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Philosophically considered, the universe is composed of Nature and the Soul. Strictly speaking, therefore, all that is separate from us, all which Philosophy distinguishes as the 'Not Me,' that is, both nature and art, all other men and my own body, must be ranked under this name, 'Nature.'
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: For I have learned to look on nature, not as in the hour of thoughtless youth; but hearing oftentimes the still, sad music of humanity.
author: William Wordsworth,  Lines Composed a Few Miles Above Tintern Abbey

quote: The right of nature... is the liberty each man hath to use his own power, as he will himself, for the preservation of his own nature; that is to say, of his own life.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: That which is impenetrable to us really exists. Behind the secrets of nature remains something subtle, intangible, and inexplicable. Veneration for this force beyond anything that we can comprehend is my religion.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: I don’t have a philosophy: I have senses...If I talk about Nature, it’s not because I know what it is,But because I love it, and that’s why I love it,Because when you love you never know what you love,Or why you love, or what love is.Loving is eternal innocence,And the only innocence is not thinking.
author: Alberto Caeiro,  The Keeper of Sheep

quote: Obscenity [10w] Obscenity's undefinable becauseeverything that occurs in nature is natural.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: 'Healing,' Papa would tell me, 'is not a science, but the intuitive art of wooing nature.'
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Cats are intended to teach us that not everything in nature has a purpose.
author: Garrison Keillor

quote: One had to live a long time to know a man's true nature.
author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez,  Love in the Time of Cholera

quote: Visible objects therefore do not perish utterly, since nature repairs one thing from another and allows nothing to be born without the aid of another's death.
author: Titus Lucretius Carus

quote: We lead our lives like water flowing down a hill, going more or less in one direction until we splash into something that forces us to find a new course.
author: Arthur Golden,  Memoirs of a Geisha

quote: But in my opinion, all things in nature occur mathematically.
author: René Descartes

quote: Nothing in biology makes sense except in the light of evolution.
author: Theodosius Dobzhansky
